00013 #include <INETDefs.h>
00014 #define ERFC(x)   erfc(x)
00015 #define MW2DBM(x) (10.0*log10(x))
00016 #else
00017 #include "FWMath.h"
00018 #define ERFC(x)   FWMath::erfc(x)
00019 #define MW2DBM(x) FWMath::mW2dBm(x)

00028 bool Decider802154Narrow::syncOnSFD(AirFrame* frame) {
00029   double BER;
00030   double sfdErrorProbability;
00031 
00032   BER = evalBER(frame);
00033   sfdErrorProbability = 1.0 - pow((1.0 - BER), sfdLength);
00034 
00035   return sfdErrorProbability < uniform(0, 1, 0);
00036 }
00037 
00038 double Decider802154Narrow::evalBER(AirFrame* frame) {
00039   Signal& signal = frame->getSignal();
00040 
00041   simtime_t time = MappingUtils::post(phy->getSimTime());
00042   double rcvPower = signal.getReceivingPower()->getValue(Argument(time));
00043 
00044   ConstMapping* noise = calculateRSSIMapping(time, time, frame);
00045 
00046   Argument argStart(time);
00047   double noiseLevel = noise->getValue(argStart);
00048 
00049   delete noise;
00050 
00051   return getBERFromSNR(rcvPower/noiseLevel); //std::max(0.5 * exp(-rcvPower / (2 * noiseLevel)), DEFAULT_BER_LOWER_BOUND);
00052 }
00053 
00054 simtime_t Decider802154Narrow::processNewSignal(AirFrame* frame) {
00055   //if we are already receiving another signal this is noise
00056   if(currentSignal.first != 0) {
00057     return notAgain;
00058   }
00059 
00060   if(frame->getChannel() != phy->getCurrentRadioChannel()) {
00061     // we cannot synchronize on a frame on another channel.
00062     return notAgain;
00063   }
00064 
00065   currentSignal.first = frame;
00066   currentSignal.second = EXPECT_HEADER;
00067   Signal& s = frame->getSignal();
00068   double bitrate = s.getBitrate()->getValue(Argument(s.getReceptionStart()));
00069   simtime_t phyHeaderDuration = ((double) phyHeaderLength)/bitrate;
00070   return s.getReceptionStart() + phyHeaderDuration;
00071 
00072 }
00073 
00074 simtime_t Decider802154Narrow::processSignalHeader(AirFrame* frame)
00075 {
00076   if (!syncOnSFD(frame)) {
00077     currentSignal.first = 0;
00078     //channel is back idle
00079     setChannelIdleStatus(true);
00080     return notAgain;
00081   }
00082 
00083   // store this frame as signal to receive and set state
00084 //  currentSignal.first = frame;
00085   currentSignal.second = EXPECT_END;
00086 
00087   //channel is busy now
00088   setChannelIdleStatus(false);
00089 
00090   //TODO: publish rssi and channel state
00091   // Inform the MAC that we started receiving a frame
00092   phy->sendControlMsgToMac(new cMessage("start_rx",RECEPTION_STARTED));
00093   Signal& s = frame->getSignal();
00094   return s.getReceptionEnd();
00095 }
00096 
00097 simtime_t Decider802154Narrow::processSignalEnd(AirFrame* frame)
00098 {
00099   ConstMapping* snrMapping = calculateSnrMapping(frame);
00100 
00101   Signal& s = frame->getSignal();
00102   simtime_t start = s.getReceptionStart();
00103   simtime_t end = s.getReceptionEnd();
00104 
00105   AirFrameVector channel;
00106   phy->getChannelInfo(start, end, channel);
00107   bool hasInterference = channel.size() > 1;
00108 
00109   if(hasInterference) {
00110     nbFramesWithInterference++;
00111   } else {
00112     nbFramesWithoutInterference++;
00113   }
00114 
00115   double bitrate = s.getBitrate()->getValue(Argument(start));
00116 
00117   double avgBER = 0;
00118   double bestBER = 0.5;
00119   double snirAvg = 0;
00120   bool noErrors = true;
00121   double ber;
00122   double errorProbability;
00123 
00124   simtime_t receivingStart = MappingUtils::post(start);
00125   Argument argStart(receivingStart);
00126   ConstMappingIterator* iter = snrMapping->createConstIterator(argStart);
00127   double snirMin = iter->getValue();
00128   // Evaluate bit errors for each snr value
00129   // and stops as soon as we have an error.
00130   // TODO: add error correction code.
00131 
00132   simtime_t curTime = iter->getPosition().getTime();
00133   simtime_t snrDuration;
00134   while(curTime < end) {
00135     //get SNR for this interval
00136     double snr = iter->getValue();
00137 
00138     //determine end of this interval
00139     simtime_t nextTime = end; //either the end of the signal...
00140     if(iter->hasNext()) {   //or the position of the next entry
00141       const Argument& argNext = iter->getNextPosition();
00142       nextTime = std::min(argNext.getTime(), nextTime);
00143       iter->next(); //the iterator will already point to the next entry
00144     }
00145 
00146     if (noErrors) {
00147       snrDuration = nextTime - curTime;
00148 
00149       int nbBits = int (SIMTIME_DBL(snrDuration) * bitrate);
00150 
00151       // non-coherent detection of m-ary orthogonal signals in an AWGN
00152       // Channel
00153       // Digital Communications, John G. Proakis, section 4.3.2
00154       // p. 212, (4.3.32)
00155       //  Pm = sum(n=1,n=M-1){(-1)^(n+1)choose(M-1,n) 1/(n+1) exp(-nkgamma/(n+1))}
00156       // Pb = 2^(k-1)/(2^k - 1) Pm
00157 
00158 
00159       ber     = getBERFromSNR(snr);
00160       avgBER  = ber*nbBits;
00161       snirAvg = snirAvg + snr*SIMTIME_DBL(snrDuration);
00162 
00163       if(ber < bestBER) {
00164         bestBER = ber;
00165       }
00166       errorProbability = 1.0 - pow((1.0 - ber), nbBits);
00167       noErrors = errorProbability < uniform(0, 1);
00168     }
00169     if (snr < snirMin)
00170       snirMin = snr;
00171 
00172     curTime = nextTime;
00173   }
00174   delete iter;
00175   delete snrMapping;
00176 
00177   avgBER = avgBER / frame->getBitLength();
00178   snirAvg = snirAvg / (end - start);
00179   //double rssi = 10*log10(snirAvg);
00180   double rssi = calcChannelSenseRSSI(start, end);
00181   if (noErrors)
00182   {
00183     phy->sendUp(frame,
00184           new DeciderResult802154Narrow(true, bitrate, snirMin, avgBER, rssi));
00185     if(recordStats) {
00186       snirReceived.record(10*log10(snirMin));  // in dB
00187     }
00188   } else {
00189     MacPkt* mac = static_cast<MacPkt*> (frame->decapsulate());
00190     mac->setName("BIT_ERRORS");
00191     mac->setKind(PACKET_DROPPED);
00192 
00193     PhyToMacControlInfo::setControlInfo(mac, new DeciderResult802154Narrow(false, bitrate, snirMin, avgBER, rssi));
00194     phy->sendControlMsgToMac(mac);
00195     if(recordStats) {
00196       snirDropped.record(10*log10(snirMin));  // in dB
00197     }
00198     if(hasInterference) {
00199       nbFramesWithInterferenceDropped++;
00200     } else {
00201       nbFramesWithoutInterferenceDropped++;
00202     }
00203   }
00204 
00205   //decoding is done
00206   currentSignal.first = 0;
00207 
00208   //channel is back idle
00209   setChannelIdleStatus(true);
00210 
00211   //TODO: publish rssi and channel state
00212   return notAgain;
00213 }
00214 
00215 double Decider802154Narrow::n_choose_k(int n, int k) {
00216   if (n < k)
00217     return 0.0;
00218 
00219   const int       iK     = (k<<1) > n ? n-k : k;
00220   const double    dNSubK = (n-iK);
00221   register int    i      = 1;
00222   register double dRes   = i > iK ? 1.0 : (dNSubK+i);
00223 
00224   for (++i; i <= iK; ++i) {
00225     dRes *= dNSubK+i;
00226     dRes /= i;
00227   }
00228   return dRes;
00229 }
00230 
00231 double Decider802154Narrow::getBERFromSNR(double snr) {
00232   double ber = BER_LOWER_BOUND;
00233   double sum_k = 0;
00234   if(modulation == "msk") {
00235     // valid for IEEE 802.15.4 868 MHz BPSK modulation
00236     ber = 0.5 *  ERFC(sqrt(snr));
00237   } else if (modulation == "oqpsk16") {
00238     // valid for IEEE 802.15.4 2.45 GHz OQPSK modulation
00239     const double dSNRFct = 20.0 * snr;
00240     register int k       = 2;
00241     /* following loop was optimized by using n_choose_k symmetries
00242     for (k=2; k <= 16; ++k) {
00243       sum_k += pow(-1.0, k) * n_choose_k(16, k) * exp(dSNRFct * (1.0 / k - 1.0));
00244     }
00245     */
00246     // n_choose_k(16, k) == n_choose_k(16, 16-k)
00247     for (; k < 8; k += 2) {
00248       // k will be 2, 4, 6 (symmetric values: 14, 12, 10)
00249       sum_k += n_choose_k(16, k) * (exp(dSNRFct * (1.0 / k - 1.0)) + exp(dSNRFct * (1.0 / (16 - k) - 1.0)));
00250     }
00251     // for k =  8 (which does not have a symmetric value)
00252     k = 8; sum_k += n_choose_k(16, k) * exp(dSNRFct * (1.0 / k - 1.0));
00253     for (k = 3; k < 8; k += 2) {
00254       // k will be 3, 5, 7 (symmetric values: 13, 11, 9)
00255       sum_k -= n_choose_k(16, k) * (exp(dSNRFct * (1.0 / k - 1.0)) + exp(dSNRFct * (1.0 / (16 - k) - 1.0)));
00256     }
00257     // for k = 15 (because of missing k=1 value)
00258     k   = 15; sum_k -= n_choose_k(16, k) * exp(dSNRFct * (1.0 / k - 1.0));
00259     // for k = 16 (because of missing k=0 value)
00260     k   = 16; sum_k += n_choose_k(16, k) * exp(dSNRFct * (1.0 / k - 1.0));
00261     ber = (8.0 / 15) * (1.0 / 16) * sum_k;
00262   } else if(modulation == "gfsk") {
00263     // valid for Bluetooth 4.0 PHY mandatory base rate 1 Mbps
00264     // Please note that this is not the correct expression for
00265     // the enhanced data rates (EDR), which uses another modulation.
00266     ber = 0.5 * ERFC(sqrt(0.5 * snr));
00267   } else {
00268     opp_error("The selected modulation is not supported.");
00269   }
00270   if(recordStats) {
00271     berlog.record(ber);
00272     snrlog.record(MW2DBM(snr));
00273   }
00274   return std::max(ber, BER_LOWER_BOUND);
00275 }

00277 void Decider802154Narrow::channelChanged(int /*newChannel*/) {
00278   //TODO: stop receiving
00279   ;

00281 
00282 void Decider802154Narrow::finish() {
00283 
00284   // record scalars through the interface to the PHY-Layer
00285   phy->recordScalar("nbFramesWithInterference", nbFramesWithInterference);
00286   phy->recordScalar("nbFramesWithoutInterference", nbFramesWithoutInterference);
00287   phy->recordScalar("nbFramesWithInterferenceDropped", nbFramesWithInterferenceDropped);
00288   phy->recordScalar("nbFramesWithoutInterferenceDropped", nbFramesWithoutInterferenceDropped);
00289 }
